Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jan1168
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 4 bed suite last week. It was a very well decorated and kept hotel. It is a 20 minute walk to the nearest tube station, however there is regular bus service which stops near the hotel. A travel pass enables you to travel on all public transport so you don't need to worry about buying bus and tube tickets. The reception staff are exceptionally helpful and all speak excellent English. The bedrooms were lovely with the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in! Breakfast was very good. There was a range of options. They catered for specialty diets and had a range of the most scrumptious cakes and pastries. The usual cereals breads etc. The hot options were limited with only scrambled eggs (although there were a few varieties of scrambled eggs) and boiled eggs. To be honest there was so much variety with the cold options we weren't bothered. The location is a very safe residential area. We will definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “Good; but go prepared”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonrfc
Reviews.Content: the Fenix does offer good value for money. Our first visit to Rome, and we had not done our research. learn the public transport before you go for the first time as taxis do not operate properly or honestly in Rome. This hotel is near to a metro stop and very close to the bus stops. Good points then are location, the staff, cleanliness, some good local bars and restaurants nearby, nice garden, wonderful cappuccino (and I am very fussy about coffee). Negatives are the breakfast (rubbish really), toilet muzac in the bar, and noisy if on the front side. So, if you book, ask to be on the rear side, and don't expect the first meal of the day to be the best! Hang onto your wallet in Rome. The professional thieves are everywhere (not a comment on this hotel. The Fenix does offer good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: Gerrit K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is a fair walk to the closest metro (Bologna), but the busstop is relative closeby at the Via Nomentana. To the Piaza Venetia runs bus nr36 in about half an hour via Termini. After 24.00 hrs the trafic noise from the Via Gorizia becomes much less in my room at the street side. Excellent roomservice at all hours!

Reviews.Title: “a charming little place not in the center of things”
Reviews.Author: mikethegypsy
Reviews.Content: nestled in the residential parioli district about a 12-minute bus ride from the train station, the hotel offers fine service, decent-sized rooms, and a very good buffet breakfast. one morning there was even blood oranges in the made-from -scratch fruit salad. the number 36 or 84 bus stops right across the street. the hotel is within walking distance of the villa borghese, modern art gallery, and right down the street from st. agnes outside the walls with its first-century catacombs. decent restaurants, shops, and supermarkets abound. a find in a city no longer the budget oasis it once was. place also supports a cozy bar overlooking an open area outside, and a reading/games room. hotel is also totally handicapped accessible. that the lighting in rooms lacked subtlety and that furniture is dated are my only reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent product/price ratio - Smallish rooms and beds - Wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: cho10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on many occasions although not frequently. Their rooms are smallish as are their beds (queen size bed at best for two - i.e. a little more than "una piazza e mezza"). That is why I have not given them 5 stars (i.e. excellent). Value, service, courtesy, cleanliness, sleep quality are all first rate. Location wise the hotel is not central which means having a car (they offer parking for an extra) or use of taxis or public transportation if you want to visit Rome and its monuments. The price of an "all you can est" buffet continental breakfast is included in the room cost which, for an Italian hotel is almost a miracle. If you consider that their breakfast is not based on the usual stale "yesterday's brew" coffee typical of many Italian hotels as well as the majority of French hotels the "miracle" status is even more apparent. I have been told that the hotel's restaurant is very good but I can't judge as I have never eaten there. Price wise Euros 100 in Rome with an official invoice for two people including breakfast is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice 30 Minutes from City Center”
Reviews.Author: maimonChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a leafy, well to do neighborhood up on a hill away from the city center. It's a good choice if you are visiting the University (La Sapienza). With one exception, the staff was helpful and friendly. There's a decent restaurant in the basement and a small bar on the first floor. Rooms are average size.

Reviews.Title: “Well located gem”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust058
Reviews.Content: Near a metro stop, or bus line, but outside the noisy hubbub of the centre, this hotel is located on a treed, quiet street with comfortable rooms. The staff worked diligently to see that our stay went well. A nice respite to come home to after a day of touring.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag...”
Reviews.Author: ValRober
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fenix provided us a lovely, but small room with a very comfortable bed for our visit to Rome last week. I agree with some of the other posts here that the breakfast buffet was pretty ordinary and the staff did seem jaded...a perfect word to describe them. They just weren't very warm and welcoming. When asked to recommend nearby restaurants, the gentleman behind the desk only suggested the one in the hotel. We did eat dinner there because we were too exhausted from sightseeing and the pastas we tried were excellent. However the service was awful! We did not mind the location of the hotel because it was in a lovely area near a main artery into the city. There are many restaurants that you can walk to nearby. And it was a bit of a respite from the hectic pace of the center of Rome. There is a fairly nice courtyard area for sitting outside and reading.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel outside the centre”
Reviews.Author: Capobart
Reviews.Content: Realy nice hotel with beautiful decorated rooms. Great disadvantage: the hotel is situated very far from the city centre. If you want to visit all the things that make Rome famous, you have to walk (30 minutes), or take one of the (frequent) busses. The outside of Hotel Fenix is terrible, but look through that and enter the beautiful redecorated rooms and halls. Breakfast is okay, allthough you have to pay for some extra's (fresh juice, special baked eggs).

Reviews.Title: “A Surprise (and Delighful) Move to This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfdrummer
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel when the air conditioning at our booked hotel didn't function and my traveling companion -- who is an asthmatic -- needed a place with all-night A/C. We reluctantly packed up and moved to the Fenix, only to find that it was absolutely wonderful! I would say that the room was a bit larger and more comfortable than the average Italian hotel room; the daily breakfast was lovely and varied; the location was beautiful (off the tree-lined Via Nomentana, and with restaurants and a drugstore nearby) and just a short bus or cab ride from the heart of Rome; the garden was very nice; the service both in the hotel and out in the garden was impeccable; and overall we were very happy to be there! Oh,and it also feautures round-the-clock room (and garden) service! I would go back any time, and I'm just glad that fortune took us to the Fenix. I will add my usual note to benefit asthma sufferers: this hotel had the best-functioning and longest-running (24/7) air conditioning we've ever experienced in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: greenapple2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent! – friendly and helpful staff, fantastic breakfast (very good cappucino) and great location. We will definetely return soon. Thank you for making our holiday a great one!

Reviews.Title: “functional, helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: bigpip
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife at the fenix for 5 nights during our stay in Rome. The staff were friendly and helpful. Some reviewers commented on the rooms being small. I felt our room was typical of hotel room size and suited our needs. It was clean, linen changed regularly, towels changed daily. Everything that was supposed to work, worked. Breakfast was more than enough for our needs. The hotel offered what it said on the tin. If I was being picky, I would say the carpets were a bit tired looking. The hotel was a short distance from the city centre, so you had to commute by bus or subway to get there. You could walk, which we did once, but it's a bit of a distance and leaves your energy spent for trawling around the streets of Rome - not as young as I once was. If you arrive at the Termini, it only cost about 10 euros to the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed out time at the Fenix. Not the most opulent hotel I've stayed in but it was value for money, especially compared to hotels nearer Rome centre. From my experience, I would recommend it for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Far from world heritages, but nice for business trip”
Reviews.Author: JImmieNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed there two nights for my business trip. It is located far from Roman world heritages in the embassies' area in Roma, so I think you would use a taxi from Termini station. Breakfast was included in the room rate and a cup of hot cappuccino was served in the morning. My room was large for one person furnished one king sized bed. I couldn't see any dogs which someone reported on this web-site. I felt it was comfortable and happy to stay in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for Dogs”
Reviews.Author: HerbDecaturGA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for over a week at Fenix. One night we were awakened at 5am by clattering on the floor above, and dog barking. Upon inquiry, we ascertained that the floor of the room above us was uncarpeted, so dogs could stay in it with owners, and possible messes could be cleaned easily. The lack of carpeting magnified every noise from above (our room was carpeted - it was a small suite, and expensive). Breakfast was very good, and the staff helpful and bilingual, although we received no reduction for the dog barking problem. The laundry service was very good, and our room was well cleaned. Fenix claims to be 'centrally-located,' but it is several km from the tourist attractions, none of which are around Fenix. Via Nomentana, a few steps away, has frequent local and express bus service. Fenix promised 'garden views,' but the garden could hardly be seen from our suite.

Reviews.Title: “THe worst hotel i have ever experienced, nearly ruined our whole stay”
Reviews.Author: chreastine
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have been compelled to write a review and I am a frequent traveller. First of all this place is in no way at all a four star hotel!! I would rank it more of a 2 star, maybe 3 but thats pushing it. The room was so tiny, there was barely enough room to walk round the small double bed. We had one pillow each and they had to be folded as they seemed to vanish under your head they were so thin. The bathroom had no bath, but a shower which made this terrible screeching sound and would spray in all directions. The Tv was a small old fashioned one with no english channels. The man at the desk was not very amicable at all,. just to give you an idea, we missed breakfast and were told we could have a coffee and a pastry at the bar, ( which consisted of one small table and 2 chairs), I was given a cold pot of water for my tea, an expresso instead of a cappucino and we gave up waiting for our croissants after 20 minutes. We were able to laugh about it at the time but it was not a comfortable or welcoming place to stay and I feel i should warn others before they make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but more like 3*”
Reviews.Author: funkysmile
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in December. Not sure it should be classed as a 4* hotel, probably more 3* than 4*. The good: - location is ok - a few good restaurants nearby and only 10-15 euros for a taxi in to the centre of Rome. I would recommend booking an airport transfer car though - only works out 5-15 euros more than a taxi and a lot more comfortable. - reception staff are relatively friendly and helpful. - relatively cheap. The bad: - a guest (or local resident) was allowed to walk around the hotel with 2 big dogs unleashed which wasn't what you would expect. - the airport transfer I had booked was for an agreed price. When it came to getting out of the car the driver asked for 10 more euros than what had been agreed. To the staff's credit they reimbursed me for this though. - apparently it's illegal for them to provide an iron to residents... so they can charge 7 euros for ironing the sleeves of my wife's dress. - on check out they had marked our bags for the wrong room so took an extra 10 mins to find them.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice quiet hotel in wonderful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: kmez50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April for a conference. We had a small room but large bed and tiny bathroom and ate a large yummy breakfast every morning. We loved the neighborhood with stores and grocery nearby and convenience of the bus just a few blocks away takes you straight to St. Peters Square. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. There are several hotel dogs on site too. Neighborhood felt very safe. Very walkable area. Only issue is the neighborhood is so quiet and not many restaurants in the neighborhood that are open on Sunday and Monday evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, slightly far away from the center”
Reviews.Author: maltakate
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel, rooms are not too large but large enough,clean, bathroom fully equipped with toiletries, large bath towels and a pair of slippers. Comfortable beds, nice furniture in rooms, lovely garden, good breakfast and friendly staff. The only drawback to this hotel is that it is a bit far out from the centre and we always used a taxi to get there and back. However taxis are not so expensive. We were a group of thirteen and we all enjoyed our stay here. If you need airport transfers, definitely contact stefano from Romecabs.

Reviews.Title: “Calm, pleasant location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Chil_18th
Reviews.Content: Being just a 10 minute bus-ride (90 or 90d Via Nomentana) out of Rome Termini and situated in a pleasant suburb populated by embassies I'd say it was in an excellent location if you're travelling with children or if you prefer calmer surroundings - a Roman version of St John's Wood. At the far end of the Viale Gorizia you'll find banks, shops, cafes and restaurants - ideal spot for a quiet meal, a stroll and a gelato at the end of a busy day's sightseeing, out of the crush and inflated prices of the city centre. Architecturally, the hotel itself is somewhat out of character with the traditional ochre/pink/saffron buildings nearby but inside is cool and tastefully furnished. Our twin room was extremely clean, the air-con worked well and the bathroom was a little cramped but perfectly adequate. The tip I read on Trip Advisor to take a travel kettle and a few tea-bags is a good one as the room has a mini bar but no facilities to make a cup of tea. Breakfast was very good - a typical cold buffet of cooked meat, cheese, bread, pastries and fresh fruit etc. with hot food limited to scrambled eggs. We didn't use the restaurant in the evenings, preferring to eat out instead. The staff were polite, friendly and helpful. We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 000jesus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great neighborhood. There is no way I'd want to stay in the middle of town where tiny rooms cost a fortune. In exchange for being 15 minutes away, you get a great room at a bargain price. The nearest metro stop is a bit of a walk, but buses stop next door very often and deliver you straight to Termini (and riding a bus in Rome is an adventure everybody should experience). Hotel Fenix also has the advantage of being in an actual Roman neighborhood. Rome is one of the most touristy places on Earth. During the day, you'll see more Americans than Italians. It was nice to eat breakfast and dinner among the families and people who actually live there. And that means better food since it isn't made specifically for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: WestsideJack
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for sightseeing prior to taking a cruise from Civitavecchia. Wonderful tree-lined neighborhood (Trieste) a 10-15 minute walk to Bolonga Metro Station. Great breakfast buffet. Staff very helpful -- even loaned me an electrical adapter to charge my laptop. Free computer with Internet for guest use in lobby. Room a bit small, but clean. Paid $82 USD per night for a single room booking through hotels.com Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AndreasA77
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel close to the city centre. Clean cozy rooms with towelwash every day. Wery nice breakfestbuffet. Nice staff and a beautiful garden where you can drink the tasty Cappuccino.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in the 'burbs”
Reviews.Author: benw123
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Fenix for a short break in Rome, and I relied on the guides written here when booking it. You guys didn't let me down! It is a fair distance from the city centre but we used the nearest Metro stop at Bologna to get in and out . As previously mentioned, it is only a 10 minute walk across a safe, quiet neighbourhood. The hotel hand out a piece of paper with details of the Metro and bus links, but we couldn't figure out which bus number went where, so we stuck to the Metro instead. To get to Fenix from FCO airport, use the 30-minute Leonardo Express (11 euros) to the Termini, then Bologna is just three stops east on Line B. On arrival we used the Left Luggage at the Termini so we could make the best use of our time exploring the city, before retiring to the hotel at the end of the day (for more details on this, I found a good website http://www.roninrome.com with lots of travellers tips in Rome). We stayed on the third floor overlooking the main road, but the windows are very well insulated and you'd only hear the odd noisy motorbike in the room. In terms of interior quality, ours was fine if a little dark yet everything was clean and in good order. Same goes for the rest of the hotel - it is generally in good condition. It has a nice garden for guest use, too. Bad points? Well, there is a PC for guests to use which I assumed was free but we were hit with a modest (and surprising) 5 euro charge upon checkout, and while the restaurant served good food in the evening it was totally lacking in atmosphere - they leave the flat screen TV on! There was a mini bar in the room but no coffee or tea making facilities either. Breakfast was very good with a wide choice of food and drink. Staff were all very friendly and helpful too. We had a 7:30am flight home on the Sunday and they booked us a Mercedes taxi to the airport for 58 euros which wasn't bad value - this included credit card charges and a tip. Finally, I'd recommend purchasing a ROMA-PASS for your stay in Rome. This gives each person two cards; one for free transport travel (Metro/bus) and the other for two free passes to tourist attractions, both valid for three days from first use. We skipped an almighty queue at the Colosseum using these - at 23 euros per person, it's good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel just out of town...”
Reviews.Author: ConspiracyTheory
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fenix is located approximately 15 minutes away from the main train terminal if travelling by bus. Upon arrival, the staff were friendly and provided us with a map of the town center and also the numbers of the buses that ran to the major attractions and sights. The room was clean although a little dated. One complaint about the room, is that there is no tea and coffee facilities. We didn't try the restaurant as the prices were quite expensive and we onlly had one drink each from the bar. A small glass of wine and a small beer cost 10 euros. Breakfast is quite extensive with cereals, fruit, pastries, bread, etc. Pretty much an all you can eat affair. If you are looking for somewhere to stay that is on a smaller budget, then this is the place. If you stay here, its worth buying one of the bus passes that are available at any newstand. The buses get you everywhere, are fairly frequent and pretty easy to work out where each one goes!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on outskirts of city”
Reviews.Author: jacqui83Leeds
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fenix is a decent sized hotel on the outskirts of the city centre. There is a bus stop on the main road just outside the hotel however we chose to use the Metro. The nearest station is Bologna on Metro Line B and is about a 10-15 minute walk through a safe neighbourhood. We stayed in room 102 which despite being right next to the lift and stairs was very quiet. The room and bathroom were both a decent size and the decor was modern. The hotel provided a really good map of the area (not many guide book maps go out as far as the hotel) and info on what there is to do during the stay. Breakfast was very good with a buffet of cereals, fruit, toast, eggs, hams and cheeses and toast and pastries. You also had the choice of eating in the large dining room or on the terrace outside. The terrace garden area was a really nice place to relax with a very reasonably priced drink before going out for dinner. The staff were very helpful and polite. This hotel was very nice however some people may find it located a little too far out of the main city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fenix gives you the best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: DarbysDad
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fenix was a delight for me. I discovered that it is located just far enough outside the congested city center, in a beautiful tree-lined neighborhood (Trieste) where you will encounter mostly only Romans. Nearby there was excellent bus service to the Coliseum and the Roman Forum (take bus # 84) or to the Vatican (take bus # 62). This is a best-of-both-worlds location for travelers like me, and it’s not far from Rome’s main train station. The hotel staff was very polite, from the Director/Manager right on down to the chamber maids. The main lobby desk people are a font of information who can direct you to most anywhere, whether close or in the city center, and even beyond. Add to all of this Hotel Fenix’ beautiful, gourmet restaurant, a cozy, tiny intimate bar, a wealth of nearby restaurants where the locals go, and very good local shopping. I came away with a very rich encounter with these exceptional Italians, whether Fenix staff, or local merchants and restaurateurs right there in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: James-TRIP
Reviews.Content: This is a small Hotel that in its day I'm sure was lovely. It is now showing its age as with most its very rude staff. The rooms are ok and have good AC, but they are tired and old and cleanliness could be better. I had mould around the bath and a spilt drink from the previous guest was all over the wall. I stayed for 4 nights of which 1 day my room was not serviced at all. A used room service tray stayed in my room from the first day until I check out and my mini bar was not re-filled. Sheets were not changed once. The Reception staff are the rudest you will come across - REALLY! As Hotels in Rome can get filled up and expensive, if your not fussy and not looking for service then this is just ok but I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having a less than desirable hotel last year in Rome, the Hotel Fenix was a wonderful surprise. This hotel had a warm and cozy feel about it, which may be due to its small size. Besides all the amenities one could expect in a European hotel, they even had free internet access. The location being in a residential neighborhood is a bit away from the sights, however, it is very easy to get around by taxi or public transportation. While the room was small, it was nicely furnished, and the bathroom appeared to be brand new. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, and although we only had breakfast in the restaurant, it was more than adequate. The outdoor garden area was a real treat. There you found comfortable furniture under canvas gazebos where you could spend leisure time reading a book and having a glass of wine. This was great! I will definitely return to the Hotel Fenix on my next trip to Rome, and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four day break in Rome...After reading so many reviews on the very different accommodation on offer we decided to choose the Fenix Hotel. From the moment of stepping through the doors the staff were both friendly and very helpful. Information on local transport was very useful as the taxi drivers in Rome tend to rip people off ie 75 euro from the airport to the hotel!!!!! The local bus stop is just around the corner from the hotel and the 84 or 36 takes you straight into the city centre about a 30 min journey Monday to Saturday they run up until midnight but on a Sunday the last bus back to the hotel is around 8.30. Just a short stroll from the Fenix there are a few nice, reasonable priced places to eat, the area is safe and fairly quiet for Rome. The bedrooms are very nicely furnished, very clean and of a good size. Breakfast too was very enjoyable and we weren't given dirty looks when we arrived late one morning.....Thanks to all the staff you were great!!! Would definately stay here on our next trip to Rome, especially as we now know how to get around on public transport.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Fenix
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Gorizia 5-7, 00198 Rome, Italy
